index.title: 去中心化仲裁平台
index.subtitle: 区块链争议解决方案为大家提供更快、更好、更经济地实现公正的仲裁。

section-example-dispute.title: 新经济中的一个普通争议
section-example-dispute.paragraph-1: 爱丽丝（Alice）雇用鲍勃（Bob）建立一个网站。
section-example-dispute.paragraph-2: 爱丽丝提前付款给鲍勃。
section-example-dispute.paragraph-3: Bob建立该网站花费的时间超出了他的预期。
section-example-dispute.paragraph-4: 当他终于建好了网站交工，爱丽丝并不满意。
section-example-dispute.paragraph-5: 辩论开始了，爱丽丝要求退款， 鲍勃声称建网站的描述不清楚。
section-example-dispute.paragraph-6: 爱丽丝（Alice）和鲍勃（Bob）都无所适从，他们的争议没有明确的结果。

section-internet-economy.title: 互联网经济
section-internet-economy.subtitle: 随着我们的生活转向全球在线平台，争议出现在传统法院体系无法解决的领域中。

section-why-kleros.title: 为什么选择Kleros？
section-why-kleros.paragraph-1: 一个使用众包和区块链将争议解决流程交到社区手中的对等平台。
section-why-kleros.paragraph-2: Kleros使用先进的加密货币经济学和全球陪审员社区，更快、更好、更经济地实现司法正义。<anchor>阅读白皮书了解更多内容</anchor>。
section-why-kleros.paragraph-3: Pinakion（PNK）令牌可保护系统免受攻击，同时还为陪审员提供了经济上的动力来协调解决案件。<anchor>点击这里了解更多内容</anchor>。

section-how-does-it-work.title: 它如何运作？
section-how-does-it-work.paragraph-1: 爱丽丝聘请鲍勃为她建立一个网站。 他们同意在发生争议时使用Kleros。
section-how-does-it-work.paragraph-2: 爱丽丝对鲍勃的工作不满意，并提出了争议。
section-how-does-it-work.paragraph-3: 随机选择用户作为争议的陪审员。
section-how-does-it-work.paragraph-4: 陪审团评估证据并投票给爱丽丝作为获胜者。 她得到退款，诚实的陪审员因其工作获得报酬。

section-justice-revolution.title: 参与公正的革新
section-justice-revolution.paragraph-1: 成为陪审员, 为世界提供公正并获取报酬.
section-justice-revolution.paragraph-2: 将Kleros强大的争议解决技术免费集成到您的平台中。

about.title: 关于我们
about.subtitle: Kleros是一个开放源代码的在线争议解决协议，它使用区块链和众包来公平地解决争议。该协议的开发工作由Kleros合作社协调，Kleros合作社是一家在法国成立的法国国际合作社（SCIC）。我们的研究和代码开发是开源的，任何人都可以免费使用。

section-who-are-we.title: 我们是谁？
section-who-are-we.paragraph: 我们是一支跨学科的国际团队，对区块链及其变革法律和治理的潜力充满热情。Kleros的愿景是建立开放技术，为未来的仲裁提供支持。

section-meet-our-team.title: 与我们的团队会面
section-meet-our-team.paragraph: Kleros由一支高素质的团队组成，涵盖去中心化司法的所有必需学科：智能合约安全，计算机科学，加密经济学，商业，市场营销和通信。

section-join-our-team.title: 加入我们的团队！
section-join-our-team.subtitle: 检查下面的空缺职位，加入公正的革新！

category-general.name: General
category-general.q-1: Can you really trust a decision made by a bunch of anonymous people on the Internet?
category-general.a-1: Satoshi Nakamoto taught us that a number of anonymous computers who do not trust each can still reach consensus, provided incentives are correctly structured. Kleros extends this principle to human decision making. A number of anonymous jurors who do not trust each other can reach consensus on a right decision, provided incentives are correctly structured. To learn more about the incentive system, read our white paper.
category-general.a-2: The supply of pinakion is fixed at one billion units.
category-general.q-3: Does a party who wants to have a case adjudicated need to have pinakion?
category-general.a-3: No, only jurors will need pinakion in order to be drawn. Parties don’t even need to know what a pinakion is.
category-general.q-4: Is the identity of jurors revealed?
category-general.a-4: Since decisions made in Kleros affect the allocation of resources, there is an incentive for parties to try to bribe or intimidate the tribunal. Anonimity is intended to protect jurors from intimidation and retaliation. It also simplifies the process of users becoming jurors and avoids the costs of identity verification. By providing a secure environment and simplifying the selection process, Kleros greatly enlarges the pool of potential jurors. This results in lower arbitration costs and the democratization of access to justice.
category-general.a-5: Team Members: 18% First Round of Token Sale: 16% Airdrop: 4% Subsequent Rounds and Juror Incentive Program: 50% Kleros Cooperative Development Reserve: 12%
category-general.q-6: Could Kleros become a platform used by mainstream online retailers such as eBay or Amazon?
category-general.a-6: Yes, by adopting Kleros, any mainstream e-commerce platform could enjoy a fast, affordable and transparent dispute resolution method. If you want to learn more, contact us.

category-integration&partners.name: Integration & Partners
category-integration&partners.q-1: We are from organization X and would like to use Kleros. However, for XYZ reasons, we can't use anonymous jurors. Can we tweak Kleros in order to only select jurors from a pre-vetted pool?
category-integration&partners.a-1: At this point, it is not possible to select jurors from a pre-defined pool. Anyone having tokens can self-select to be drawn randomly as a juror. However, we understand that selecting jurors from a pre-vetted pool is important in many use cases. If this is your situation, please contact us on contact@kleros.io. We would like to know more about your use case.

category-jurors.name: Jurors
category-jurors.q-1: Can appeals be managed outside of Kleros?
category-jurors.a-1: Yes, it’s possible to create an arbitrable smart contract which uses Kleros for solving first instance disputes and allows appeals to be handled outside of Kleros.
category-jurors.q-2: Do you have sample contracts that show what type of disputes could be adjudicated by Kleros?
category-jurors.a-2: While at this point there are some sample smart contracts, this is an area that requires further development. Kleros focuses on the dispute resolution process, not on the contract drafting itself. Other companies in the ecosystem will focus on drafting contracts. In order to be arbitrable by Kleros, a smart contract needs to follow the smart contract standard we have developed. Check out our GitHub repository for more information and join our discussion on Telegram if you're interested in following the development.
category-jurors.q-3: Have you considered how jurors might be vetted, as well as their experience and expertise, to enable them to participate in specific courts/disputes?
category-jurors.a-3: In decentralized systems, the main problem of vetting jurors is: `Who vets the vetters?`, which is a chicken and the egg problem. One of the most attractive features of public blockchains is that anyone can join, so nobody gets to monopolize the ledger.
category-jurors.q-4: How is evidence presented and managed by the system?
category-jurors.a-4: The way in which evidence is presented depends on the type of dispute. A freelancing dispute will require different evidence than an insurance or a payment dispute. Kleros Cooperative provides a back end for jurors to arbitrate disputes. The way in which it is built makes it possible for anyone to develop their own front end. The logic is similar to the Ethereum Wallet. The Ethereum Core Team provide a wallet to users, but anyone can build an Ethereum wallet. This means, for example, that an e-commerce platform could build a front end on which users could arbitrate disputes without leaving the platform. The front end would tap into Kleros' juror network. We expect many companies from the ecosystem to build interfaces based on our platform. To learn more, read this article about the evolution of Kleros Cooperative's ecosystem.
category-jurors.q-5: Since jurors are drawn from a global pool, how would you make sure that they all speak the language the dispute is called in?
category-jurors.a-5: Kleros is made of subcourts specializing in different types of disputes. Language is one of the specialization parameters. For example, there could be a “website dispute court in English”, a “website dispute court in Spanish”, “website dispute court in French”, etc.
category-jurors.q-6: How do you know that jurors reviewed the evidence instead of just voting randomly?
category-jurors.a-6: Kleros does not have a specific way to make sure that jurors reviewed the evidence. The way to make sure that jurors act honestly is through the creation of right economic incentives. Jurors who vote randomly without reviewing the evidence are more likely to vote incoherently with the majority and lose the token they staked to be drawn. Hence, they lose money on average. Over time, this would make dishonest jurors leave the court. To learn more about how incentives work in Kleros, read the white paper.
category-jurors.q-7: Are jurors required to provide a justification for their vote? Is the justification revealed to the disputing parties and to others jurors?
category-jurors.a-7: Yes, jurors are required to provide a justification in the form of a short text. Justification is then revealed to the disputing parties as well as to other jurors after the voting is complete.
category-jurors.q-8: Are there time limits for disputes? Do jurors have to respond withing a given period of time?
category-jurors.a-8: Yes, each subcourt has a time period within which jurors need to submit their decision. Jurors will be notified of pending cases in need of resolution.
category-jurors.q-9: What happens to jurors who don't respond or review the evidence within the set time frame?
category-jurors.a-9: Jurors who don't give their ruling before the deadline are penalized by losing some of their staked tokens and by not receiving the arbitration fee.

category-legal.name: Legal
category-legal.q-1: In legal systems such as the United States, judges are responsible for instructing jurors and explaining legal nuances. How does Kleros address questions of interpretation of legal terms in the contract?
category-legal.a-1: A moderator in an online forum follows some predefined rules to decide whether a user comment violated the terms and conditions. When making decisions, jurors follow similar previously defined rules, which instruct them on how to deal with legal nuances. In early stages of the project, however, Kleros is intended be used for simpler cases, where legal nuances are not as important.
category-legal.q-2: Which are the main legal and regulatory hurdles in setting up Kleros?
category-legal.a-2: Because of its innovative practice based on cryptoeconomics, Kleros is not recognized as arbitration according to international agreements. This could be an obstacle for adoption in “mainstream” use cases (e.g., a government regulator could not use Kleros for settling disputes between, say, a credit card company and its users). However, this should not be an obstacle to adoption in other use cases (especially those within the crypto industry). As Kleros is able to prove that it can solve disputes in non-mainstream use cases, we expect interest to arise in mainstream use cases. Eventually, arbitration associations will accept the Kleros approach to dispute resolution. The Kleros platform is an 'opt-in' system meaning the enforcement is automatic and pre-accepted by contracting parties agreeing on using Kleros as an arbitrator.

escrow.title: Blockchain Escrow Service
escrow.subtitle: Trade, hire and pay secured by trustless dispute resolution.

section-risks.title: The Risks of Contracting Online
section-risks.paragraph: Companies usually contract services online from freelance designers, community managers and developers. But there's a big risk that the work will not be done or will be done in poor quality.

section-meet-escrow.title: Meet Kleros Escrow
section-meet-escrow.paragraph: Send the payment into an escrow account. If a dispute occurs, a panel of Kleros jurors will handle resolution. Kleros Escrow protects both the buyer and the seller by ensuring both parties perform according to the agreement.

section-trustless-escrow.title: Trustless Decentralized Escrow
section-trustless-escrow.subtitle: Secure, efficient and trustless escrow secured by blockchain.
section-trustless-escrow.paragraph-1: Are you building a platform for e-commerce, freelancing, finance...? Disputes will arise. Integrate Kleros to solve them. You send us a dispute, Kleros sends you a decision.
section-trustless-escrow.paragraph-2: Kleros selects a crowdsourced jury to make the ruling. Upon reviewing the evidence, jurors will make a decision enforced by smart contract. All evidence is secured in the blockchain and nobody can tamper with the procedure. To learn how this works, read <anchor>Kleros whitepaper</anchor>.
section-trustless-escrow.paragraph-3: Kleros brings a trust standard to online transactions. With Kleros Escrow, buyer and seller can be confident that the other party will fulfill the obligations of their agreement.
section-trustless-escrow.illustration-1: Go to Kleros Escrow and create a new transaction.
section-trustless-escrow.illustration-2: Enter the details of the agreement.
section-trustless-escrow.illustration-3: If there are no disputes, you can pay the balance in full and that's it.
section-trustless-escrow.illustration-4: If a dispute is raised, with just one click you can send the contract to dispute resolution.
section-trustless-escrow.illustration-5: Jurors evaluate the evidence and make a decision. Funds are sent to the winner. Case closed.

section-want-to-use.title: Want to Use Kleros Escrow in your Platform?
section-want-to-use.subtitle: Contact us now and we will help you with integration.

curated-list.title: Decentralized Curated Lists for Just about Anything
curated-list.subtitle: Empower the community to organize information in your platform...

section-why-curated-lists.title: Why Curated Lists?
section-why-curated-lists.paragraph: Decentralized platforms need a way to decide what content to display. What tokens to list on an exchange? Which comments to censor on a social media platform? Whoever controls the list has the power. True decentralization requires empowering the community.

section-why-ours.title: Why Use Our Curated Lists?
section-why-ours.paragraph: Kleros offers a solution for numerous decentralized platforms. Use Kleros' system to seamlessly curate your lists.

section-trustless.title: Trustless Curated Lists
section-trustless.paragraph-1: You define the guidelines required for what can and can't be accepted on the list. Users send items. Other users challenge bad submissions. Kleros decides.
section-trustless.paragraph-2: Jurors, review the evidence provided by both submitter and challenger, cast their vote and the outcome of the dispute is enforce automatically.
section-trustless.paragraph-3: In the decentralized era, a larger number of platforms require decentralized list curation. They range from decentralized e-commerce, social media, finance, insurance and many other fields looking to curate data in a permissionless way.
section-trustless.illustration-1: A decentralized e-commerce platform has a policy of not accepting dangerous items.
section-trustless.illustration-3: Another user challenges the submission for being a dangerous item.
section-trustless.illustration-4: The flamethrower goes to trial in Kleros platform.
section-trustless.illustration-5: Jurors rule for the challenger. The flamethrower is rejected from the list.

section-contact-us.title: Contact Us
section-contact-us.subtitle: Implement Kleros list curation in your platform. Contact us now!

oracle.title: Kleros Oracle
oracle.subtitle: A Trustless Way to Enter Information On-Chain

section-problem.title: The Oracle Problem
section-problem.paragraph: In order to work, smart contracts often gather information from the outside world such as the winner in an election or the amount of rainfall in a specific region. The `Oracle Problem` is about finding a trustworthy way to introduce this information on-chain.

section-why-ours.title: Why Kleros Oracle?
section-why-ours.paragraph: Kleros can provide resolution for disputes about regarding which information should be included on-chain and if the answers to certains questions or queries are correct.

section-trustless.title: Trustless Oracle
section-trustless.paragraph-1: Users submit external information (the price of ETH in USD, whether there was a flood in NYC, etc.) and a deposit. If a dispute arises about the truth of this information, Kleros provides dispute resolution. For more information about how this works, read <anchor>this article</anchor>.
section-trustless.paragraph-2: By using an oracle based on Kleros' decentralized jurors opens up the potential for a wide variety of useful, practical dApps outwith the blockchain only sphere. The Kleros Oracle is a revolutionary step into the blockchain infrastructure of the future.

cooperative.title: Join Coopérative Kleros
cooperative.paragraph: Development efforts for the Kleros protocol are coordinated by Coopérative Kleros, a Société Coopérative d’Intérêt Collectif (SCIC) incorporated in France. Read <anchor>this article</anchor> to learn more about the legal structure. If you want to become a member of the Cooperative, follow the next steps. Your application will have to be approved by other members.

section-procedure.illustration-2: Print it; Fill it in (don't forget the handwritten phrase at the end!); Sign it; Scan it;
section-procedure.illustration-3: Send it back to <email>lola@kleros.io</email> along with a digital copy of your passport / national ID and with the TxID of your share deposit.

court-tour.title: Kleros Court Tour
court-tour.paragraph: Liked the tour and want to test the real product, but never used crypto? Not to worry, click on Crypto Beginner’s Guide.

section-token.paragraph-1: First and foremost, PNK holders can stake their token in a Kleros court to indicate their availability to serve as jurors. The more they stake, the more chances they have of selection. Jurors stake their PNK in courts they have relevant skills for with a random number generator (RNG) selecting the final spots based on size of stake.
section-token.paragraph-2: PNK is a protection against Sybil attacks. In order for an attacker to flood the juror pool, they need to buy enough PNK so that they are selected enough times to be a juror for the same case in order to change the outcome. Using a native token like PNK offers several key advantages for minimizing the risk of 51% attacks versus using an external cryptocurrency like ETH.
section-token.paragraph-3: Imagine that someone does buy 51% of the PNK in an effort to attack Kleros. Maybe their attack will be subtle and go unnoticed. However, it’s more likely the community will realize that it is under attack. In this case, Kleros would lose credibility as an arbitration platform and the value of PNK would decrease. Then the attacker would take a substantial loss on PNK bought, representing a high economic attack cost.
section-token.paragraph-4: Users have an interest in holding PNK tokens in order to gain voting rewards when taking part as jurors. They also have the opportunity to vote with their PNK on all Kleros Governance related proposals and votes creating an open and unbiased platform for all.

banner.title: If you are interested in acquiring PNK token OTC, get in touch
banner.subtitle: Note that in order to ensure fairness in token distribution, tokens are sold to buyers at prices reflected by the market.

juror.title: Become a Kleros Juror
juror.subtitle: Use your skills to earn money and bring justice to the world.

section-benefits.title: Benefits
section-benefits.paragraph-1: Earn arbitration fees each time you rule on a dispute.
section-benefits.paragraph-2: Help others solve their disputes. Be a force for good.
section-benefits.paragraph-3: Learn new skills while you adjudicate cases.
section-benefits.paragraph-4: Rule one case a month or many cases a day. You choose how much to work.
section-benefits.paragraph-5: No special requirements. Anyone can be a juror.
section-benefits.paragraph-6: Start today and take part in the future of justice!

section-how.title: How It Works
section-how.illustration-1: When a dispute starts, the smart contract automatically draws a predefined number of jurors.
section-how.illustration-2: If you are drawn, you will arbitrate on the case.
section-how.illustration-3: If you rule correctly, you’ll receive payment in ETH for your work.
section-how.illustration-4: If you are in the majority ruling, you will also receive some PNK.

section-start.title: Start as a Juror Now!
section-start.subtitle-2: Choose your court and stake your PNK
section-start.subtitle-3: Wait to be drawn and start ruling!

partner.title: Become a Partner
partner.subtitle: Integrate Justice as a Service (JaaS) on your platform.
partner.paragraph: Are you building a marketplace, a content sharing platform or any other that requires dispute resolution? Send your disputes to Kleros and our protocol returns them resolved.

section-benefits.title: Benefits
section-benefits.paragraph-1: Kleros is simple to integrate removing the burden of dispute resolution from your shoulders.
section-benefits.paragraph-2: Kleros is fast and cheap. In most cases, it comes at zero cost.
section-benefits.paragraph-3: Fully decentralize all of your disputes. Have them solved in the Kleros court.
section-benefits.paragraph-4: Kleros is always online, solving disputes - around the clock, throughout the year.
section-benefits.paragraph-5: Use Kleros and support the open source movement!

section-integration.title: Full Integration Support
section-integration.subtitle: The Kleros team will give you full support and guidance throughout the integration process.

section-partner.title: Become a Partner Now
section-partner.subtitle: Start using open justice as a service in your platform!
